intro: Geranium robertianum subsp. purpureum, commonly known as the purple geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped, serrated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from June to August. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The subspecies is distinguished by its more intense purple flower color compared to other forms of Geranium robertianum.
